column5: We have a dominos near us. Husband is stuck at work with a bad cold until 10:30 pm. Pizza would be a nice surprise for him!
I‚Äôve been following this post for a few hours now and it has me so paranoid I keep checking my drawers to make sure my knives are still there.
YTA. It‚Äôs not your choice to decide what pronouns others go by. You respect their pronouns or fuck off with your bullshit.
YTA. There‚Äôs better ways to go about getting your money than to keep the ashes of his pet that just passed. Show a little compassion.
NTA. Your sister should have never said you would do it for free without speaking to you first.
NTA. You offered to help her, she doesn‚Äôt need to be such a crabby bitch about it when it‚Äôs not done to her liking or when she expects it to be done.
ESH. You didn‚Äôt know it was her twin and not her in the picture. But that doesn‚Äôt make the sexual comments towards a minor at the time any less weird. She‚Äôs also an asshole for slapping you.
ESH. Them for hitting you with a book and you for hitting them back. Two wrongs don‚Äôt make a right. But as a guy you should never put your hands on girl.
YTA. Why do you feel it was appropriate for you to put your hands on someone else? It makes you uncomfortable when it‚Äôs done to you. There was better ways to go about dealing with this.

YTA because when your mom told you no you acted like an entitled child. I understand it‚Äôs your money, but that‚Äôs a lot to spend on one commission. Your mom does have a point. I‚Äôve worked with people who do commissions and you can get great pieces for much cheaper.
NTA. Let her entitled ass buy her own car.
YTA. If you don‚Äôt want the homemade peanut butter cups I‚Äôll take them! üòã

ESH. Her for acting like she‚Äôs entitled and you for not putting in much effort. Birthdays are obviously very important to your sister, it wouldn‚Äôt have killed you to do something nice for her to make her feel special that day.
YTA. Why move there if you hate them so much?

YTA. Fucking with someone else‚Äôs grades like that on purpose is a shitty thing to do. No, they shouldn‚Äôt be asking you for the answers but you can just say you aren‚Äôt going to tell them anything.
YTA. Just because you‚Äôre family doesn‚Äôt mean that you are entitled to his money. He owes you absolutely nothing.

YTA. It‚Äôs your cat, your responsibility. If you can‚Äôt afford to properly provide for her you should consider giving her to someone who can. What are you going to do if she becomes sick and needs vet care? Or worse, gets out and comes back pregnant. How will you care for the kittens?
ESH. You are being paranoid, however for safety reasons though he should be more mindful about wearing them all the time when he‚Äôs out in public.
I don‚Äôt think a doctor is going to remove whatever it is you‚Äôre talking about for no reason...this is a weird post.

ESH. Just move the books before you use the sink so they don‚Äôt get wet and then put them back when you‚Äôre done. But also, why does your mom study in the bathroom of all places? That‚Äôs weird and a bit gross.

NAH. They‚Äôre your parents and are just concerned about you. However you‚Äôre entitled to your privacy and therapy is your safe space. It‚Äôs totally ok not to share as long as you aren‚Äôt in any danger.
It‚Äôs one thing to go out and celebrate a new, fresh beginning. It‚Äôs another thing to go out and celebrate the death of two kids which is exactly what they did.
YTA. Bullying is never okay and I‚Äôm sorry for what they did to your son. However celebrating the fact that two young lives were lost in a tragic accident is disgusting. Shame on you.
Yes, they‚Äôre totally an asshole for doing something that makes them happy. How dare they!

YTA if boredom is truly the reason you‚Äôre falling asleep. But if you really can‚Äôt control it I‚Äôd see a doctor because you may have a medical condition such as narcolepsy or something that‚Äôs making you sleep so much.
All relationships are different. It‚Äôs a public place, OP can go there when they please. Their partner doesn‚Äôt get to control where they do or don‚Äôt go.

NTA. Lots can go wrong on a wedding day. Dress issues, flowers don‚Äôt show up, catering isn‚Äôt up to par, the DJ is late, bad weather, etc. By saying good luck you‚Äôre just wishing that the day goes smoothly and according to plan for them. There‚Äôs nothing wrong with that!
NTA. If there‚Äôs other seats they can sit in one of those. There‚Äôs no reason for someone to want to sit right next to you on an empty bus unless they‚Äôre being a creep.
Good to know. I‚Äôll just ignore them from now on.

If he wanted to keep it a place to go with just his friends he shouldn‚Äôt have started bringing his partner there in the first place. He introduced them to the club and the dancing there. He doesn‚Äôt get to just take it away from them because he doesn‚Äôt like it anymore.
This is now the 3rd time you posted this in like 45 minutes. You‚Äôre just being a troll at this point.

YTA. I doubt the soda became flat because you shook it once, however keep your hands off of things that don‚Äôt belong to you. That was a stupid joke. What was it supposed to accomplish? What if he opened it when he came back and it sprayed all over and made a mess?
NTA. Coming out is a very personal thing and it‚Äôs not fair of your friend to try to make you do it before you‚Äôre ready.
NTA. Your partner sounds insecure. If you‚Äôre having fun and not doing anything wrong I say go for it and enjoy yourself! It‚Äôs just dancing.
NTA. Just be honest and say that too much noise keeps you awake and you feel better on the couch.

I don‚Äôt think she was pretending to be something she‚Äôs not. More like she had interest in something or at least thought she did and then after awhile realized she didn‚Äôt like it as much as she may have thought she did. Interests change over time.

YTA. Mental illness is rough, I‚Äôm right there with you. But a relationship is a partnership, it should be 50/50. You both working to help support each other financially, mentally, around the house...etc. you aren‚Äôt holding up your end of it. Eventually that does lead to harsh feelings and resentment. You need to start working on getting yourself better so you can start contributing again. Get to the doctor, get some medication, find a therapist or if you‚Äôre really having a rough time, get admitted to the hospital for a little bit until they can stabilize you. You can‚Äôt just lay down and let your illness take over.
NTA. She‚Äôs your child, it would be wrong not to include her in your special day. There‚Äôs no reason any other children need to be in attendance if you don‚Äôt want them to be.
YTA for trying to turn her into something she‚Äôs not. It sounds like she‚Äôs tried but she‚Äôs just not into it like you are. People have different likes and interests and that‚Äôs ok!
Kids say stupid things. But this goes above and beyond just saying something stupid. He‚Äôs literally threatening the life of someone else. That‚Äôs not ok at any age.

NTA. You‚Äôre looking out for your moms best interest and nobody can fault you for that. It sounds like your mom has some issues and could use some help seeing things clearly. I‚Äôm not sure if your words will change anything but it‚Äôs worth a try.
Why are you posting this again? You got plenty of answers on your previous post.

NAH. I have mental health issues too and I get it. My husband is a great support but he has a life too and I can‚Äôt always rely on him to make me feel better. The same goes for you. Your boyfriend had plans. He talked with you as long and he could and then went out to enjoy himself. You need to find some ways to cope with your mental health issues on your own without relying on someone else constantly. It‚Äôs easier said than done but the only person you can 100% rely on all the time is yourself.
NTA. He‚Äôs staying in the room you‚Äôre paying for. He should have asked first.
Disgusting yes, but still harmless!

So he should just continue to go to school and have to feel unsafe and get told he‚Äôs going to be murdered? He should absolutely speak up and say something. Why wait until there are warning signs and it‚Äôs possibly too late.
NTA. If he‚Äôs making threats you need to report him right away!
NTA. Your brother is old enough to pay for his pizza on his own. He shouldn‚Äôt keep coming to you for the money because he doesn‚Äôt plan accordingly and makes sure he has the cash on hand.
Try posting this in r/advice You might get a better response there.
NTA for now. I feel like there‚Äôs some of the story missing here. You said she blocked you because you put her relationship in danger...how were you a danger to her relationship?
NTA. I would have slammed the door in their face for being such a jerk about it.

NAH. You‚Äôre grown and can do what you want. It‚Äôs kind of weird that he would reach out after so long. Just be careful OP. If he was abusive in the past there‚Äôs no way of knowing what his motives are.
YTA. Maybe she just needs some practice? She‚Äôs not going to get better if people don‚Äôt let her drive places.
NTA. This is between your brother and your grandfather. I wouldn‚Äôt get in the middle of it.
NTA. Your mom should have written the information for her account down. Maybe try contacting Spotify and see if they can help you.
But if we are wearing blindfolds who is going to drive us to the taco stands? Your plan sounds dangerous.

I‚Äôm a woman and I‚Äôve never done that. But then again I‚Äôm not a shallow asshole. I‚Äôd rather get to know someone and base my opinion of them on their personality rather than going on looks alone.
YTA. What gives you and your friends the right to judge anyone else based on how they look?

YTA. Try to see if from the Youtubers perspective. It‚Äôs probably pretty creepy to have a fan send something to your house randomly. Just because the address is somehow listed on the internet doesn‚Äôt mean you should use it.

Of course people are allowed to grow and change. However, even if she has changed and is a better person now that doesn‚Äôt undo any damage she‚Äôs caused people in the past by bullying. You can forgive but never forget. It seems to me like the OP is still very hurt by her actions. I just wish they went ahead and dealt with that hurt in a different way instead of retaliation.

NTA. Your husbands friend sounds like a weirdo. 

Also, I‚Äôm sorry for your loss OP! ‚ù§Ô∏è
ESH. Him for dragging out the prank for so long and you for getting upset over something so harmless.
ESH. Her for being a bully to begin with and you for sending those messages out to be put in the paper. That‚Äôs a bully move. You‚Äôre no better than she is now.
NTA. It was 20 minutes. If he couldn‚Äôt handle that what‚Äôs he doing being a godfather to your child? What if something happens and he needs to step up and take responsibility for your son.

NTA. It doesn‚Äôt matter how many other masks are on hand, your co worker should not be stealing from her job. Everyone has families they need to protect. There‚Äôs ways to do that that don‚Äôt involve stealing.

NAH. My husband and I call each other tons of nicknames too and I may have accidentally called him a chunky butt once. He got offended because he is sensitive and it sounds like your boyfriend is too.
NTA. You bought the ticket before you knew when the wedding was. They just happened to fall on the same day. That‚Äôs not your fault.

YTA. Why does it matter how he writes a post on his Facebook? As long as he‚Äôs not being hateful and saying bad things his formatting shouldn‚Äôt really matter that much that you needed to call him out on it.

ESH. All school is hard. But, some majors are a lot harder than others. I think your friend is a jerk for belittling what others are doing and I think your a jerk for what you said to her. You‚Äôre also a bit of a jerk for going into her messenger and reading her private conversations.

This is weird...I don‚Äôt even know what to say to this because it almost sounds fake. I‚Äôve never heard of findom before. So this guy gave you money just because he got a thrill out of it? What did you give him in return? I‚Äôm not trying to be disrespectful, I just really don‚Äôt understand this. If he gave you the money willingly, I‚Äôd say there‚Äôs no reason to give it back to him. Maybe this will teach him to be smarter with his money and not do silly things when he has a family to support. NTA.

I don‚Äôt blame you for not wanting to do anyone else‚Äôs job. I wouldn‚Äôt either! Group projects just suck all around for numerous reasons. Somebody had to do the conclusion, and she‚Äôs the asshole for slacking on her part and not doing it. ESH for different reasons. I‚Äôm glad it got done, that‚Äôs the important part. Hopefully you all get a good grade!

ESH. This is why I hate group projects because your grade literally depends on how others do their work. You all should have communicated with each other better and worked together a little better so you could all accomplish your tasks on time. I understand the frustration of your friend when they got angry about the mistakes on your part of the assignment. Part of your job should have been to proofread your part and fix the errors before you sent it off. It shouldn‚Äôt be up to someone else in the group to fix it. As far as the conclusion goes, it sucks that nobody else had finished their work and was able to do it so it got put on you. But someone has to do it. If you had the easiest part I don‚Äôt see any harm in them asking you to do a little extra while they finished up what they had to do. It might not be fair that you had to do extra work but in group projects the work load isn‚Äôt always going to be an even split.

NTA. I‚Äôm assuming you have a job so some of the money in your account belongs to you. If that is the case I see no problem wanting to treat your kids to dinner. It‚Äôs really not any of your new husbands business how you choose to parent, regardless of how old your kids are. It seems to me, based on the point you brought up about the tires, that he wants to be the big hero and the one to pay the way but only when it‚Äôs convenient for him to do so. Good for you for standing your ground!

YTA. You should have picked your daughter up and took her inside until the dog was gone. Then you should have called the local authorities to properly handle the issue if the dog was as aggressive as you say it was.
I just read your edit. Yeah you‚Äôre definitely an AH. Clean up after yourself, it isn‚Äôt rocket science.
YTA. Just because everyone else leaves their trash there doesn‚Äôt mean you should too. Clean up after yourself!
This is gross. YTA for even taking the time to type that out. ü§Æ

There was a family that lived down the street from me growing up that had kept trying until they had a boy. They had six girls before they got their boy. Seven kids total. I have a feeling this will be Kail except the other way around.
NTA. That teacher needs to have a sip of water and calm down.
That is one very full bowl...respect to that server. I would have spilled it everywhere.

ESH. I could see where your brother is coming from when he says you‚Äôre a financial drain if he thinks you‚Äôve been living there for so long with no job or source of income for yourself. Why not just let him know you‚Äôre working and doing well for yourself and your father? You don‚Äôt have to go into specific details. But it seems like you could be saving yourself a lot of family drama just by letting him in a little.
YTA. Give them a chance to do right by their child.
NTA. If she wanted it she should have taken it with her or been more clear with your father on what she deemed was appropriate to get rid of.

ESH. Your husband isn‚Äôt a child and you shouldn‚Äôt have to put parental blocks on his phone to stop him from viewing things he shouldn‚Äôt be. He needs to get control of these habits on his own. I‚Äôm glad y‚Äôall are going to couples counseling but I really hope he is planning on doing some counseling solo to work on his issues.

NTA. You got her one flower, that was plenty. If she wanted you to get her another flower she could have offered you the money to pick it up for her. It‚Äôs rude to ask someone to get you something and not offer to pay for it.

The last therapist I had I could text and call as well. Sometimes it took some time for her to respond but she always got back to me. I recently stopped seeing her and one of the last things she said to me via text message was ‚Äúyou know how to reach me.‚Äù

‚ÄúI didn‚Äôt call that person a psychopath.‚Äù

Next comment- ‚ÄúI was calling the person who I was arguing with a psychopath.‚Äù

See how you just contradicted yourself. Just stop.
Girl, hahaha omg. We can see all of your comment history. Busted!
Have a mirror? There is a psychopath here but it isn‚Äôt the OP. üò¨üò¨üò¨
Yep. You are. What an asshole thing to say.
NTA. I understand it‚Äôs your sisters wedding but your daughter has to come first. You did what you could to try and find a sitter she was comfortable with, unfortunately it just didn‚Äôt work out.

There is a 3,000 character limit so I couldn‚Äôt explain all that I needed too. We adopted the dog the same day, we did not bring him home the same day. We spent almost two months driving to the shelter every weekend to see him before bringing him home as we were having work done on our house and it wasn‚Äôt ready for us to move in yet.
We tried scolding him, we tried treats. But there were certain times he was like a totally different dog and even we were scared of him because he would become some unpredictable.

We did attempt to introduce him to people gradually. He knew my parents well from going over their house for visits, and he did great with my dad coming over. My mom however he tried to bite and he knew her. We‚Äôve talked to trainers and explained the problems. And we were told with his level of aggression he needed intensive training but they weren‚Äôt sure even that would correct the issue.

He was never off leash in the yard, he always had a lead on and broke off of them. We had plans to get a fence but it was not a requirement to adopt this particular dog at the shelter, they said he didn‚Äôt need one and a lead would be fine. We had tried to train him ourselves going off a books and YouTube and we got some little things under control, but the aggression was not an issue we could correct ourselves.

We had a saving account prior to getting the dog for him. But it was quickly gone through because every time he needed a vet visit, even for a simple nail trim, it cost us over $400 because he needed to be put under each time due to his anxiousness and aggression. I tried to mention this in my post but there is a 3,000 character limit. I agree with you, people shouldn‚Äôt get pets they can‚Äôt afford. However a line has to be drawn somewhere. In the year we had him we spent thousands on him. We had plans to get a fence but it was not a requirement for adoption at the shelter, they said he would be fine on a lead and didn‚Äôt need one.

We had a saving account prior to getting the dog for him. I was making meowing noises to get her to look at the camera so I think she was a little bit confused üòÇ
But if that were the case wouldn‚Äôt the spot where the box was taken from be covered with snow too? It‚Äôs odd that it would snow and cover the footprints but not the area the box was at.
